business.headline: Cryptocurrencies here to stay as an asset class, says Ruchir SharmaIn an interview with India Today News Director Rahul Kanwal, Ruchir Sharma explained why cryptocurrencies, alongside gold, are emerging as long-term alternatives to traditional assets, particularly the US dollar.

China's stimulus may stabilise economy, but won't solve crisis: Ruchir SharmaIn an interview with India Today News Director Rahul Kanwal, Ruchir Sharma highlighted that China's growth is unlikely to exceed 2.5% annually over the next decade.

Only a weaker dollar will bring foreign investors back to India: Ruchir SharmaIn an interview with India Today News Director Rahul Kanwal, Ruchir Sharma explained that the primary factor hindering foreign capital inflows into India is the strength of the dollar.

Should India worry about Donald Trump's tariff plans? Ruchir Sharma explainsRuchir Sharma warned that under Donald Trump, India must brace for a more transactional approach, where deals could be made based on America's interests.

Booking plans job cuts as part of company's reorganisation planBooking Holdings, which owns brands like Booking.com and Kayak, did not disclose how many jobs would be affected but said it expected to provide more details on timing, likely impact on employees and financials "in due course".

Elon Musk's Tesla hits $1 trillion market value after Trump winThe electric automaker's shares jumped 8.2 per cent to $321.22, catapulting the company's valuation above the trillion-dollar mark for the first time in more than two years.

A woman's soulmate is another woman: Kalli Purie at Business Today MPW 2024Kalli Purie, Vice-Chairperson and Executive Editor-in-Chief, India Today Group, delivered the vote of thanks at Business Today's Most Powerful Women 2024 awards.

Watch: Trailblazers awarded at Business Today's Most Powerful Women 2024Business Today unveiled the 21st edition of its Most Powerful Women in Business list on Friday, celebrating 60 exceptional women leaders who are pioneering change, driving growth, and inspiring progress across diverse industries. This year's edition brings in 12 fresh faces and recognises four returning achievers, underscoring the dynamic nature of leadership in business. Watch the award ceremony here on India Today.

I salute the trailblazers: Kalli Purie at Business Today's Most Powerful Women eventKalli Purie, Vice-Chairperson and Executive Editor-in-Chief, India Today Group, lauded the growing accomplishments and transformation of women leaders in India.

Trailblazers on Business Today's Most Powerful Women 2024 listThis year's Business Today Most Powerful Women list introduces 12 new faces, four returning achievers, and 37 repeat honourees from last year. Two trailblazers entered the MPW Hall of Fame after seven-time wins.

Americans can learn a lesson or two from India: Piyush Goyal on women representationUnion Minister of Commerce & Industry Piyush Goyal lauded India's approach to women's empowerment and said that Americans can learn a lesson or two from India on women representation.

Harley-Davidson tariffs to be cut after Trump's return? Piyush Goyal respondsSpeaking at the Business Today's Most Powerful Women 2024 event, Piyush Goyal expressed India's openness to reconsidering the tariffs on the iconic motorcycles.

Women leaders share insights on achieving work-life balance and success at BT MPW 2024At the Business Today MPW 2024 session, Ritu Arora, CEO & CIO of Allianz Investment Management, Asia Pacific, Nirupa Shankar, Joint MD of Brigade Group; and Devita Saraf, Chairperson & CEO of Vu Group, shared insights on striking a fine balance between work, life, health and wealth.

Women need to move from being savers to investors: Radhika GuptaSpeaking at the Business Today Most Powerful Women 2024 event, Radhika Gupta, MD and CEO of Edelweiss Mutual Fund, emphasised the need for women to move beyond saving and start investing.

It's not complicated: Radhika Gupta urges women to manage their own moneySpeaking at Business Today's Most Powerful Women 2024 event, Edelweiss Mutual Fund Managing Director and CEO Radhika Gupta said that while women have been the "chief financial officers" of their households for generations, it's time to extend that role into the financial markets.

Women have always had a tough time breaking barriers in business: Padmaja Ruparel at BT MPW 2024Speaking at Business Today's Most Powerful Women 2024 event, Padmaja Ruparel said women always had a tough time breaking barriers in business.

Zomato, Swiggy accused of unfair practices in food delivery market: ReportThe investigation found these companies implemented practices that gave preferential treatment to certain restaurants on their platforms.
Sensex, Nifty end in red as FII selling offsets IT gains; RVNL tanks 6%The S&P BSE Sensex dropped 55.47 points to settle at 79,486.32, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 89.95 points to 24,109.40.

Shiv Nadar, billionaire with a big heart, donates Rs 2,153 crore in FY24For the third time in five years, Shiv Nadar and his family have topped the EdelGive-Hurun India Philanthropy List 2024, contributing Rs 2,153 crore in the fiscal year 2024.

Sharan Hegde of 1% Club faces criticism after laying off 15% employeesPopular finfluencer Sharan Hegde is facing backlash after announcing layoffs at his company, 1% Club. His LinkedIn post has drawn criticism from many on social media.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Ajit Pawar rejects BJP's 'batenge toh katenge' pitch: Won't work in MaharashtraBJP's 'Batenge Toh Katenge' slogan, which calls for Hindu unity, will not work in Maharashtra, NCP leader Ajit Pawar emphasised, adding that the focus should be on 'Sabka Saath, Sabka Vikas.'

Donald Trump wins Arizona, clinches all 7 swing states in US election victoryDonald Trump won the battleground state of Arizona, completing a sweep of all seven battleground states in the 2024 US presidential election.

Bulldozer justice unacceptable: DY Chandrachud's final verdict as Chief JusticeChief Justice of India DY Chandrachud warned against the danger of selective demolitions as acts of reprisal and called for accountability of state officials involved in such actions. He argued that this unlawful 'bulldozer justice' should lead to disciplinary and criminal actions.

Karnataka halts property mutations, withdraws notices amid Waqf land disputeKarnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah has halted property mutations amid the Waqf land dispute, ensuring farmers face no penalties and action against officials for unauthorised decisions.

How many meals should Indians have in a day?Needless to say, mealtimes are sacred in every Indian household, with many following a strict four-meal routine—breakfast, lunch, chai time, and dinner. But have you ever wondered if this is truly the best approach?

Encounter erupts between terrorists and security forces in SrinagarA gunfight between militants and security forces erupted in Srinagar's Harwan during a cordon and search operation on Sunday. No casualties have been reported so far.

SA vs IND, 2nd T20I Preview: Abhishek Sharma in focus as India eye 2-0 leadSouth Africa vs India, 2nd T20I preview: India will look to continue their winning run and avenge their defeat at Gqberha from last year. Young Abhishek Sharma in focus as the opener is under pressure to score big runs. A bit of rain is forecast for Sunday.

Trump rules out Indian-origin Nikki Haley for White House role: Won't be invitingIn a statement posted on Truth Social, President-elect Donald Trump announced that former US Ambassador to the United Nations Nikki Haley and former Secretary of State Mike Pompeo will not be joining his new administration.

Video of woman cuddling with lion cubs goes viralA video of a woman cuddling with lion cubs has gone viral on social media. In the video, the woman is seen surrounded by the cubs, who snuggle up to her like domestic pets.

Canadian police arrest 4th accused in pro-Khalistani attack on Hindu templeCanadian police have arrested Inderjeet Gosal, 35, in connection with last week's pro-Khalistani attack on Hindu devotees at a Brampton temple, charging him with assault with a weapon.

Rajasthan to paint college gates orange to create 'positive' environment for studiesUnder the Kayakalp scheme, the order will be implemented in a total of 20 colleges in the 10 divisions, on a pilot basis. The colleges have to click pictures of their gate and share it with the department after the painting is completed.

Veteran Tamil actor Delhi Ganesh dies at 80Veteran Tamil actor Delhi Ganesh died at 80, leaving behind a rich legacy in Indian cinema. His contributions spanned over 400 films across Tamil, Telugu, and Malayalam languages.

Rohit Shetty on having no Ranveer-Deepika romance in Singham AgainDeepika Padukone and Ranveer Singh's limited screen time in Singham Again left fans wanting more. Filmmaker Rohit Shetty explained the decision was to respect the film's Ramayan theme and avoid controversy.

Panicky India hell bent on playing KL Rahul. But is that the right call?India are in panic mode before the 1st Test match against Australia in Perth, believes Sanjay Manjrekar. The former player was surprised after KL Rahul was added to India's second tour game in Australia and questioned the choice made by the team management.

Gang member, out on bail, shot dead by rivals in Delhi's MundkaA 22-year-old man, a member of the Gogi gang, was shot dead in Delhi's Mundka area by members of the rival Tillu Tajpuriya gang. He was out on bail in a robbery case

Trump, Biden's post-election meeting at White House on November 13A post-election meeting is customary between the outgoing President and the incoming President, and is meant partly to mark the start of a peaceful transfer of power under America's democracy.

Viral video: Dog watches beach tennis match with hilariously human-like expressionsA viral video shows an adorable dog following the ball intently, its eyes darting back and forth across the court just like a seasoned tennis fan.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Bangladesh won't allow Sheikh Hasina's 'fascist' party to hold protests todayThe Awami League has called for a protest rally in Dhaka on Sunday. However, the interim government has said that it won't allow protests and issued a stern warning to the party.

Now Fadnavis cites Dhule example for his own version of 'batenge toh katenge'PM Modi also took part in the BJP rally in Dhule. Addressing the public, PM Modi accused the Congress and its allies of pitting one caste against another and asked people to stay united.
Watch: Florida alligator 'Darth Gator' emerges only to iconic Star Wars themePaul Bedard shared a video of an alligator Darth Gator emerging only to the iconic Star Wars theme.
From the India Today Archives (2017): How India should deal with Donald TrumpNew Delhi has a lot to gain by playing its cards well with a dealmaker who is now the US president again

Coco Gauff beats Zheng Qinwen to become youngest to win WTA Finals in a thrillerCoco Gauff became the youngest WTA Finals champion in 20 years. Defeating the world's top players, she clinched the title in a marathon battle, securing a record $4.8 million prize.

Nitin Gadkari on political crossovers: As BJP's crop grows, diseases increaseIn an interview with Mumbai Tak, Nitin Gadkari stressed the importance of maintaining the BJP's ideological integrity, particularly as the party witnesses an increase in membership from political crossovers.

Inside Kareena Kapoor's sun-kissed weekend with bright bikinis and Saif Ali KhanKareena Kapoor Khan enjoyed a quick getaway to the Maldives with her family, and shared a couple of photos from her trip online on Friday evening. The actor looked bright and rejuvenated, posing under the Maldives sun.

'Captain America Brave…' trailer: Anthony Mackie fights Harrison Ford's Red HulkThe trailer for Captain America: Brave New World showcases Anthony Mackie battling political intrigue and iconic foes, including Harrison Ford's Red Hulk.

Amaran box office day 10: Sivakarthikeyan's film explodes worldwide in 2nd weekendWith Rs 200 crore in 10 days worldwide, Tamil film Amaran is rewriting the history of cinema in the state. Starring Sivakarthikeyan and Sai Pallavi in important roles, it recorded a fantastic second Saturday domestically, taking the total earnings to around Rs 136 crore nett in India.

Rohit Shetty on having no Ranveer-Deepika romance in Singham AgainDeepika Padukone and Ranveer Singh's limited screen time in Singham Again left fans wanting more. Filmmaker Rohit Shetty explained the decision was to respect the film's Ramayan theme and avoid controversy.

sports.headline: Sanju Samson, Yashasvi Jaiswal might open for Rajasthan Royals in IPL: KaifFormer India batter Mohammed Kaif reckons Sanju Samson will open for Rajasthan Royals in IPL 2025, following his impressive century against South Africa. Kaif suggests that Samson could partner with Yashasvi Jaiswal, potentially reducing the need for Jos Buttler.

SA vs IND, 2nd T20I Preview: Abhishek Sharma in focus as India eye 2-0 leadSouth Africa vs India, 2nd T20I preview: India will look to continue their winning run and avenge their defeat at Gqberha from last year. Young Abhishek Sharma in focus as the opener is under pressure to score big runs. A bit of rain is forecast for Sunday.

Panicky India hell bent on playing KL Rahul. But is that the right call?India are in panic mode before the 1st Test match against Australia in Perth, believes Sanjay Manjrekar. The former player was surprised after KL Rahul was added to India's second tour game in Australia and questioned the choice made by the team management.

Eder Militao tears ACL as Real Madrid suffer 3 more injuries in win vs Osasuna Real Madrid defender Éder Militão ruptured the ACL in his right leg, while forward Rodrygo also sustained an injury earlier. Right-back Lucas Vázquez was substituted at halftime due to a visible leg issue.

McSweeney reacts to Border Gavaskar Test call-up: Mum, dad were super happyNathan McSweeney shared his excitement upon being named as Australia's opener for the 1st Test against India in Perth. He revealed that his parents were really happy and wished to make them proud.

Guardiola makes Premier League title admission after City lose to BrightonPep Guardiola admitted Manchester City's Premier League title hopes may be slipping away after suffering a fourth consecutive defeat for the first time in his career, allowing Liverpool to go five points clear at the top.

WI vs ENG: Phil Salt auditions for IPL auction with record-breaking hundredPhil Salt has auditioned well ahead of the IPL 2025 mega auction with a hundred in the 1st T20I between England and West Indies. His unbeaten 103 propelled England to an eight-wicket win in Barbados.

Coco Gauff beats Zheng Qinwen to become youngest to win WTA Finals in a thrillerCoco Gauff became the youngest WTA Finals champion in 20 years. Defeating the world's top players, she clinched the title in a marathon battle, securing a record $4.8 million prize.

Border Gavaskar Trophy: Australia announce surprise picks in Perth Test squadAustralia has announced a 13-member squad for the 1st Test match in Perth, set to take place on November 22. Two uncapped players, namely Nathan McSweeney and Josh Inglis have been included in the Pat Cummins-led side.

Charith Asalanka stars as Sri Lanka halt New Zealand's freight trainSri Lanka seized a four-wicket victory in a low-scoring T20I series opener against New Zealand, thanks to brilliant spin from Dunith Wellalage, Wanindu Hasaranga, and Maheesh Theekshana, while Charith Asalanka anchored the chase with a steady 35 not out.

WI vs ENG: Phil Salt auditions for IPL auction with record-breaking hundredPhil Salt has auditioned well ahead of the IPL 2025 mega auction with a hundred in the 1st T20I between England and West Indies. His unbeaten 103 propelled England to an eight-wicket win in Barbados.

Coco Gauff beats Zheng Qinwen to become youngest to win WTA Finals in a thrillerCoco Gauff became the youngest WTA Finals champion in 20 years. Defeating the world's top players, she clinched the title in a marathon battle, securing a record $4.8 million prize.

Border Gavaskar Trophy: Australia announce surprise picks in Perth Test squadAustralia has announced a 13-member squad for the 1st Test match in Perth, set to take place on November 22. Two uncapped players, namely Nathan McSweeney and Josh Inglis have been included in the Pat Cummins-led side.

Charith Asalanka stars as Sri Lanka halt New Zealand's freight trainSri Lanka seized a four-wicket victory in a low-scoring T20I series opener against New Zealand, thanks to brilliant spin from Dunith Wellalage, Wanindu Hasaranga, and Maheesh Theekshana, while Charith Asalanka anchored the chase with a steady 35 not out.

Finch defends Rohit Sharma after Gavaskar's comments, Ritika salutes playerRitika Sajdeh thanked Aaron Finch for having Rohit Sharma's back ahead of the Border Gavaskar Trophy. Sajdeh saluted Finch on Instagram, who had earlier defended Sharma against Gavaskar's comments that the batter should not captain in the tour of Australia.

9 men East Bengal get off the mark in ISL after holding off MohammedanEast Bengal earned a hard-fought 0-0 draw against Mohammedan SC, despite playing most of the match with nine men, securing their first point of the season with a resolute defensive display at the Salt Lake Stadium on November 9.

Prithvi Shaw named in Mumbai's 29-man probables for Syed Mushtaq Ali TrophyPrithvi Shaw, named in Mumbai's Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy probables, eyes a comeback after battling fitness and discipline issues. This could be a key opportunity for the once-promising cricketer to revive his career and reclaim his spot.

Insect swarms force change of time in Women's Asian Champions Trophy matchesAll matches of the Women's Asian Champions Trophy will now be held in the early afternoon to avoid potential disruptions caused by a large insect infestation in Rajgir. The insects are attracted to floodlights which might become a hazard to players and fans.

India shooters bag triple air-pistol medals in World University ChampionshipIndia's shooters opened the World University Championship with a remarkable start, claiming three medals in the 10m air pistol events. Aakash Bhardwaj and Palak secured silver, while Arshdeep Kaur added a bronze in a thrilling competition.

ISL, 1000th match: Mumbai City draw Chennaiyin FC 1-1 in action-packed gameMumbai City FC rode on left-back Nathan Rodrigues' strike to hold Chennaiyin FC 1-1 in a thrilling draw in the Indian Super League in Chennai on Saturday. This was also the 1000th match of the tournament.

Injury scares overshadow Vinicius hattrick in Madrid's win over OsasunaVinicius Jr. led Real Madrid's triumphant return to form with a hat-trick against Osasuna, but the victory was overshadowed by fresh injury concerns for Rodrygo, Militao, and Vazquez, adding uncertainty to Madrid's lineup in upcoming matches.

2nd T20I, Weather Report: Will rain play spoilsport in Gqeberha?South Africa vs India: The action shifts to Gqeberha after India beat South Africa in Durban. Here's the update on the weather conditions.

India shooters bag triple air-pistol medals in World University ChampionshipIndia's shooters opened the World University Championship with a remarkable start, claiming three medals in the 10m air pistol events. Aakash Bhardwaj and Palak secured silver, while Arshdeep Kaur added a bronze in a thrilling competition.

ISL, 1000th match: Mumbai City draw Chennaiyin FC 1-1 in action-packed gameMumbai City FC rode on left-back Nathan Rodrigues' strike to hold Chennaiyin FC 1-1 in a thrilling draw in the Indian Super League in Chennai on Saturday. This was also the 1000th match of the tournament.

Injury scares overshadow Vinicius hattrick in Madrid's win over OsasunaVinicius Jr. led Real Madrid's triumphant return to form with a hat-trick against Osasuna, but the victory was overshadowed by fresh injury concerns for Rodrygo, Militao, and Vazquez, adding uncertainty to Madrid's lineup in upcoming matches.

2nd T20I, Weather Report: Will rain play spoilsport in Gqeberha?South Africa vs India: The action shifts to Gqeberha after India beat South Africa in Durban. Here's the update on the weather conditions.

2nd T20I Predicted XI: Dayal, Vyshak debut on cards in Gqeberha?South Africa vs India, 2nd T20I: India will look to extend their run in the T20I series in the second game. After a commanding win, India might want to change their line-up slightly to accommodate debutants.

Dubey heroics takes Vidarbha closer to innings win over Himachal PradeshHarsh Dubey's career-best bowling figures propelled Vidarbha to a dominant innings-and-88-run victory over Himachal Pradesh, securing their fourth consecutive win and extending their lead in Ranji Trophy Group B.

Haryana's Yashvardhan Dalal slams 426 against Mumbai in Col. CK Nayudu TrophyYashvardhan Dalal smashed an unbeaten 426, the highest individual score in Col. CK Nayudu Trophy history, powering Haryana to 732/8 against Mumbai. His record-breaking knock featured 46 fours and 12 sixes, cementing his place among the tournament's finest performers.

BCCI verbally tells ICC India won't travel to Pakistan for Champions TrophyBCCI sources have confirmed to India Today that the Indian cricket team will not travel to Pakistan to play the Champions Trophy. While there has been no written communication between the BCCI and the ICC, the apex body has been communicated verbally.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
